acceptedAnswer.text: Smart contracts are self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement directly written into lines of code, primarily operating on blockchain platforms like Ethereum.
Smart contracts autonomously execute transactions when predefined conditions are met, without needing intermediaries, offering a decentralized method of conducting business.

mainEntity.name: What are the benefits of using smart contracts?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smart contracts offer enhanced speed, cost efficiency, transparency, and security across various sectors.

mainEntity.name: In which industries are smart contracts being applied?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smart contracts are applied across several industries, including finance and banking, supply chain management, real estate, healthcare, and intellectual property.

mainEntity.name: What challenges do smart contracts face?

acceptedAnswer.text: Smart contracts face challenges such as scalability issues and the evolving legal and regulatory landscape.

mainEntity.name: What are the future prospects for smart contracts?

acceptedAnswer.text: The future of smart contracts looks promising with developments in interoperability and integration with AI and IoT, which could redefine digital interactions.
